articles.title: About
articles.contents:
I am a PhD candidate in the Department of Epidemiology at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health. My work spans several topics in epidemiology and the social sciences, but it is united by an interest in careful design and causal inference. Currently, this includes:
Running randomized controlled trials in Uganda and Peru testing social theories about how to reduce male violence.
Theorizing about the effects of nonpharmaceutical interventions during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Developing methods for time-dependent risk prediction using the g-formula.
In this, I am aided by a fantastic, multi-displinary set of collaborators and mentors who keep me sane and are an endless source of good ideas. When not writing or coding, I enjoy baking and spending time with my wife, Jama, and our cantankerous feline, Ursula üòº.
